intro: Tetraselago wilmsii, commonly known as the Wilmsii tetraselago, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its compact, evergreen shrub form. The plant produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and requires full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
